pageTitle: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace, Release 7.0 -- System Capacity Quick Reference Tables - DocWiki
textBeforeTable: Capacity Does not support Cisco WebEx-scheduled meetings Supports both Cisco Unified MeetingPlace-scheduled meetings and reservationless meetings Single node configuration using the Hardware Media Server and Cisco Unified MeetingPlace web conferencing Six Video blades Six Audio blades Two Windows servers (the system supports a minimum of 2 servers but scales to 6 servers depending on your configuration and features) One Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Application Server using a minimum MCS-7845-I3-RC1 or equivalent. This configuration assumes the following: Configuration Details Release 7.0.3 (MR2) with Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Web Conferencing 9.6 Recommended Practices 9.5 Redundancy 9.4 Call Rate 9.3 Sizes 9.2 Capacity 9.1 Configuration Details 9 Release 8.0 Using a Hardware Media Server from Cisco WebEx 8.6 Recommended Practices 8.5 Redundancy 8.4 Call Rate 8.3 Sizes 8.2 Capacity 8.1 Configuration Details 8 Release
textAfterTable: 300 Largest possible web meeting when not using SSL or recording3 300 Largest possible web meeting when using SSL or recording3 20 Simultaneous Conference Manager sessions 1 Database replication connection per Windows cluster (internal and external). Customers desiring redundancy for the SQL database must set up a database cluster sharing that one replication connection. Footnote 1: When using a 7835 (I2 or H2) server, the maximum audio ports supports is 500, independent of audio mode. Footnote 2:For larger meetings, we recommend that you use the Cisco WebEx Event Center. Footnote 3: The Cisco MCS 7845-I3 Web Server supports a maximum of 600 web ports per server. However, the largest supported web meeting per server is subject to the size of the largest supported audio meeting per server. Audio meetings are restricted to 300 ports due to the rate at which a single Audio blade can accept traffic.
